result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stuart K Kramer not in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tyler David Rasmussen appeared by video for Stuart K Kramer. 

2:03 PM Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Matter was on the calendar for a bail modification hearing.
Parties stipulated to a modification and submitted to Court for signature.
Atty Pfeil explains reasons for the modification of the bond. 

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
This was not addressed in the stipulation.

As to this issue, the State has complied.
Atty Rasmussen has nothing further to state on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court will adopt the stipulation for the record and adopt for the record.

**CASH BOND AMENDED ON APRIL 29, 2022**
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal controlled substances. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Participate in the Portage County Justice Programs and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming. 
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

Defendant received copy of information.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

Payable Number: 59809,
Receipt Number: 22R 002631,
Amount: $20.00
Initial Appearance set for March 21, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2

1:02 PM Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge appeared in court for State of WI, Defendant Stuart K Kramer appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Taylor O Soule appeared in court for Stuart K Kramer. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Operating While Intoxicated, Great Bodily Harm. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Atty Soule indicates the defendant is not eligible for a public defender at this point. 
Defendant makes statements. 
Atty Soule advises the defendant not to make further statements at this time as it may be used against him.  

State requests $20,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule makes bond arguments to the court. 
Court questions Atty Soule. 
Atty Soule responds. 

Defendant makes statements. 
Atty Soule again advises the defendant not to speak. 
Court informs the defendant to speak with his attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal controlled substances. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Participate in the Portage County Justice Programs and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming. 
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
